title: Invoking undefined behavior in safe Rust.
body:
Certain floating point casts are legal in safe Rust, yet undefined in LLVM:

``` rust
fn main() {
    println!("{}", trigger_ub(&[1; 666])[999999]); // ~ out of bound
}

#[inline(never)]
pub fn trigger_ub(sl: &[u8; 666]) -> &[u8] {
    let idx = 1e99999f64 as usize; // Note that the float is out of the range of `usize`, invoking UB when casting.
    &sl[idx..] // The bound check is elided due to `idx` being of an undefined value.
}
```

The above code will segfault, when compiled with `-O`, due to the bound check being elided, because of the undefined behavior of casting a out of bound float to an integer.

The LLVM IR looks like this:

This is a serious unsoundness.
